intro: Praxelis kleinioides, commonly known as the Kleinioides spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species known for their milky sap. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers clustered in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
